subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]  New ideas
author: Frank Ratka
full_text:
--0-53681369-1244485636=:25671
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

On the lazer I used the lazer (I know it is spelled laser but i like to use=
 the 'z') as a transmitter. The beam itself is the carrier! As for the spir=
icom type device I used a couple cheap (29.99) multichannel walkie talkies =
that you can get at walmart or RS. I modified the transmitter side to key t=
he transmitter via computer (evpmaker) and added a 9mm jack as an input. I =
also modified the receiver by adding a 9mm audio jack so I could record wit=
h or without ambient noise.
=A0
I don't know if it makes a difference since=
 they seem to know what I'm doing with me telling them but I told them what=
 frequencies I would transmit at just in case.
=A0
Frank R.

8/09, threadsintyme@... <Threadsintyme@...> wrote:

Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:05 PM








Ver=
y interesting, Frank. I remember form an earlier post today...something tha=
t you developed a sort of spiri-com device.=A0 What did you use for the tra=
nsmitter and receiver?=A0=A0
Al
---------- Original Message ----------
From=
: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] =A0New ideas
Date: Mon, 8 Jun 2009 10:24:10 -0700 (PDT)


=






One of the techniques I played with a couple years ago was using laze=
rs. I made a box with a=A0pulse modulated lazer transmitter and photoelectr=
ic receiver. I could either transmit ambient room noise (hoping for evp), o=
r any signal I can run through=A0a 9mm connection. The clarity was phenomen=
al but the timing was out of step. I would get loooonnnnggg speech with lon=
g tones. I think the frequency of the lazer light was too high, which kept =
it out of sync with whatever level I was talking to at the time. I vowed to=
 use a green or blue lazer (shorter wavelength) to see if it helped but the=
y are pricey so it was put on hold.
=A0
Frank R.

<DIV>One of the=

I could either transmit ambient room noise (hoping for evp), or any signal =
I can run through a 9mm connection. The clarity was phenomenal but the=
 timing was out of step. I would get loooonnnnggg speech with long tones. I=
 think the frequency of the lazer light was too high, which kept it out of =
sync with whatever level I was talking to at the time. I vowed to use a gre=
en or blue lazer (shorter wavelength) to see if it helped but they are pric=
ey so it was put on hold.</DIV>
